note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
tagline: Interpolation and Statistical Proximity of 3C Tables
body:
## INSP3CT main page
Provided as supplementary alongside - 
"Spatial localization of co-regulated genes exceeds genomic gene clustering in the S. cerevisiae genome"
By Shay Ben-Elazar, Zohar Yakhini, and Itai Yanai. Accepted for publication to NAR (Dec 2012).

This program can be used to take a sparse contact dataset and interpolate it to a sampled matrix at an arbitrary resolution. On top of the resulting matrix, any set of annotation of loci is then inspected for co-localization both in 3d and 1d.
The result can then optionally be displayed in a figure similar to Figure 3 in the above paper.
name: INSP3CT
